item.title: Ethical investment gravy train veers off the rails
item.author: The Daily Telegraph
item.description: When Mark Carney corralled 450 finance companies to tackle climate change at Cop26, it seemed like a crowning achievement. Carney's Glasgow Financial Alliance for Net Zero, as it was known, joined companies that controlled $130trillion (Â£103trillion) of customers' cash. These banks, fund managers an...
